history.content:
Hi There,

You can find both EE and CS undergraduate and graduate prerequisites listed on the Berkeley Academic Guide. It's also a good idea to speak with the instructor to talk about your experience and preparedness for the class.

children.subject: I think grad course pre-reqs vary by professor, so if the professors aren't responding to email your only choice might be to physically bother them during their OH or something, or ask current undergrads in the classes, if applicable.

1. Grad classes do not have consistency in material and the material covered will totally change depending on the professor.

2. If no specific courses are stated it's because most people taking these classes (grad students) did not do their undergrad at Berkeley.

3. Whether or not prereqs are enforced usually depends on how popular the class is and is up to the professor to determine. CS 270's prereq is CS 170, but this semester it is not being enforced. Presumably EE227c is not popular enough for whatever pre-reqs to be strictly enforced for undergrads.

4. 281a requires probability at the level of Stat 134 or EE 126, and linear algebra at the level of Math 54 / CS 189 / EE 127. There was an entrance exam for undergrads.

Hello- if you are an undergrad, consent of instructor is always needed to take a grad class. I agree with that going to office hours may be your best bet. All we can do is tell you the formal prerequisites (which Lydia has already pointed out to you) so if you have other questions beyond what is listed there, you will definitely want to speak to the instructor! 

Thanks,

Sarah

Thank you for replying to my post! I have, in fact, emailed professors (I didn't get any responses) and checked the syllabi; for these courses, the prereqs listed in various terms seemed to contradict eachother and no specific course dept/# were used (e.g. "probability" or "statistics" were listed). I was wondering if you could tell me what the prereqs are for 281a, EE 227c and CS 270 (I believe 170 for this one), in particular.

history.content:
Hi all,

What are the prereqs for CS 281A, EE 227C (Convex Optimization) and CS 270, respectively?
history.subject: Prerequisites for various Grad Classes
